hours_recruitment_onboarding: In 2024, a total of 1,341 training sessions for polling and ballot-counting station personnel were conducted, each lasting no less than three hours. In addition, 372 specialized training sessions were organized specifically for Chief Presiding Officers and Chief Supervisors, amounting to a total of 5,139 training hours. No dedicated training programs are provided for temporary personnel recruited from other government agencies.
hours_training_coordination: The recruitment and assignment process for polling and ballot-counting station personnel spans a period of approximately three months.
hours_deployment_scheduling: The remuneration for polling and ballot-counting station personnel is disbursed in accordance with the standards for election-related remuneration prescribed by the Central Election Commission. Compensation is determined based on the number of ballot papers issued for elections and referenda, in line with the established payment benchmarks.
hours_payroll_processing: No post-election departure procedures are required.

Never
doc_confidence_open-ended_response: Following the completion of ballot counting, certain clerical errors or omissions in the recorded vote figures on the polling and ballot-counting station reports were identified and subsequently corrected. These post-count corrections did not affect the election results.
